title: Master Microsoft Power BI
headline: Learn meaningful data visualization and interactive report building in Microsoft Power BI with this free online course.
description: If you have ever wondered about the exciting, creative field of data visualization, then this free online Power BI training course is your complete and detailed guide to this powerful software. This video-based course will teach you how to get data from almost any source and present it in a meaningful, visually appealing, easy-to-understand format using Power BI's abundant features including how to create comprehensive reports and dashboards.
courseDescription:
Data mining and data analysis are two of the most important activities in the business world today. People are grappling with uncovering the hidden secrets within the masses of data that is generated everywhere. Do you want to derive valuable insights from data and share information with others? Microsoftâ€™s Power BI can be the most powerful tool in your arsenal. It has every feature you ever need in MS Excel and much more. It is easy to get lost in the many capabilities and functionalities of Power BI and in this Power BI certification, you will learn how to use every feature of Microsoft Power BI to your advantage and generate meaningful tables, graphs and reports. The trainer takes you step-by-step through all the essential and valuable workflows to create and share reports and dashboards. You will also have access to exercises and resource materials to practice these techniques to aid your learning.

You will begin the course by looking at business scenarios where Power BI can be beneficial, especially in comparison to MS Excel. You will study the user interface, connect to a data source, and create your first simple Power BI report. At this point, you will find that you can capture data from different data sources in one report, combine data quickly from multiple sources and then use various visualizations to present the data meaningfully. Some advanced features to extend reporting are only available in Power BI and some of what you will learn includes displaying data on maps or enriching your visualizations with radial gauges with only a few clicks. The content will also teach you how to format data using filters, slicers, and separators. Sometimes the data source does not provide all the information you need for optimal evaluation and in such cases, Power BI enables you to perform and add complex calculations, additional measures and columns with minimum effort.

To make the most of this Power BI course, a reasonable level of Excel knowledge and experience in using databases such as MS Access is helpful but not mandatory. You will need to have Power BI Pro installed on your computer to practice the exercises. If you don't want to invest in a licensed version right now, there is a 60-day free trial version that you can install. The last topic of the course demonstrates how to install Power BI Pro and activate the Power BI service, so enrol in this in-depth course and wow your audience with the most phenomenal data analysis reports they have ever seen. Whether you are in data science, finance, or even graphic design, your new data visualization skills can be used in just about any area of study or profession and can open a whole host of career opportunities.

Start Course Now

All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes 

  • Upon completing this module, you will be able to
    • Identify the Power BI components and workflows you need to create meaningful reports and dashboards.
    • Translate data into graphics using Power BI features.
    • Compare Power BI with Excel.
    • Summarize the concept of normalization of data.
    • Distinguish between different data sources.
    • Recall the advanced features of Power BI, which can be applied to a report to increase its informative value and significance.
    • Describe the different ways to format and annotate data in Power BI. 
    • Explain the role of filters and slicers in data visualization.
    • Discuss the steps to be taken to ensure that reports are displayed optimally on mobile devices.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Power BI is a powerful tool for analyzing data from a variety of data sources.
    • With Power BI, you can create automatically updated interactive reports and dashboards and develop meaningful evaluations.
    • A particular strength of Power BI is that you can work with different data sources in one report. You can even combine various data sources.
    • You can also use information from PDF and CSV files as data sources
    • Before creating a meaningful report in Power BI, you should determine which data sources you want to use.
    • Consistency of data can be achieved by a process known as "normalization".
    • To make reports and visualizations easier to read, you can insert annotations.
    • The development of values over specific periods, for example, Year-over-Year developments can be efficientlycalculated and displayed with Power BI.
    • Power BI enables you to use your own diagrams and diagrams from external providers.
    • You can use bookmarks to get to specific evaluations faster and present your reports more professionally and fluently.
    • You can also access Power BI reports and dashboards from your smartphone, tablet and even your smartwatch.

  • Working with Power BI -  Learning Outcomes

  • Upon completing this module, you will be able to
    • Explain how to format fields and add additional calculated fields.
    • Recall the available Quick Measures and how to use them.
    • Compare the different Power BI versions and offerings.
    • Identify elements that are exclusively contained in the Power BI Service.
    • Discuss the steps you need to take to share reports with other team members.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Quick measures are a tried and tested way to add complex calculations to your presentations without  familiarizing yourself with the DAX formula language.
    • Measures, like Quick Measures, do not require disk space andthey are calculated faster than reading data from a storage device.
    • The Power BI Service is the online component of Power BI. The user interface is almost identical to Power BI Desktop when it comes to creating reports.
    • The Power BI Service offers some helpful functions such as dashboards, warnings, and comments, which are not available in the Desktop version. 
    • When you publish reports, you can ensure that you only share information with those individuals who are authorized to access it.
    • Using a data gateway, organizations can leave databases and other data sources on their own networks, but still securely use this local data in cloud services such as Power BI Service.
